page.title: 04Leeds_Liverpool Canal
page.content: This waterway is one of the dominant features of Maghull and Lydiate and has been since the 18th century.It is no longer as busy as it was when Mrs Currall,ex_mayoress and former pupil of Maghull Church of England Primary School,was a child.She remembers that "On the canal used to be a lot of barges moving up and down,about 12 a day.It was always a good excuse for being late to school,being stuck on the swing bridge as the barges went past." The canal is crossed by 6 bridges in our D block,including swing bridges which are now need modernisation. This year,1985,Â£212,000 has been spent on one bridge by British Waterways and the bridge at Shop Lane has been rebuilt. There is also a plan by Sefton Council to spend considerable funds improving
